com.ratemyapp

Class RateMyApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ratemyapp.RateMyApp

  • public class RateMyApp
extends java.lang.Object
    The RateMyApp class allows to create prompts appearing at the desired intervals, asking the user to review the app and to provide feedback to the developer.

    The RateMyApp component is initialized by passing the current MIDlet instance, the Nokia Store app ID, the email address for sending feedback to, and a listener as shown below. 

     
 RateMyApp rma = RateMyApp.init(midlet, "398118", "feedback@email.com", listener);

    If the listener passed to the init method is null, the component will be automatically launched once the initialization process is complete, otherwise the listener will be responsible for programmatically launching that once it is notified of the initialization completion.

    The initialization process is asynchronous, since the component performs blocking operations that could freeze the UI. Once the initialization process is complete, the RateMyAppListener is notified via its RateMyAppListener.rmaComponentReady() method.

    Once the component is ready, it is possible to customize the prompts display intervals as shown below. 

     
 // sets the interval of the first rating dialog
 rma.setFirstCount(3);
 
 // sets the interval of the second rating dialog
 rma.setSecondCount(6);
 
 // tells the component to count only one app launch per day
 rma.setCountDays(true);

    The component uses localized resources for all displayed text. The device default locale is used, but can be overriden via the setLanguageOverride(String) method. 

     
 // sets the component locale to 'en-US'
 RateMyApp.setLanguageOverride('en-US');

    Resources are defined in XML files named with the following convention: AppResources[.<LANGUAGE_CODE>[-<COUNTRY_CODE>]].resx. The component comes with multiple localization already available, but new languages can be added, or the available ones can be overridden, by adding the relative resource XML files to the Java app project.

    If the specified locale, or the device locale if it is not programmatically overridden, is not available among the component's resources, the default 'AppResources.xml' file is used.

    Individual resource strings can be programmatically set by using the setStringResource(String, String) method. This can be useful, for instance, when a Java app already has localized strings in its own format. 

     
 // sets the rating dialog's title
 rma.setStringResource(RateMyApp.STRING_RATING_TITLE, "Do you like this app?");

    Author:
    Alessandro La Rosa
